question: 落書き
sourceMnemonic: When <kanji>writing</kanji> just happens to "<kanji>fall</kanji>" on the wall (whoops, wasn't me who did that, how strannnnge) it's writing that's not supposed to be where it is. This kind of writing is <vocabulary>graffiti</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. <ja>書</ja>, however, is kun'yomi in this case and also has rendaku. So just remember that it's read as <ja>が</ja> for this vocab and you'll be fine.
